translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The Eighth Chapter
The Discussion of the Formless Element
Are incorporeal ideas the formless element?
Agreed.

original: Vedanā bhavo gati sattāvāso saṁsāro yoni viññāṇaṭṭhiti attabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: vedanā bhavaḥ gati sattā vāso sa sāraḥ yoni viññāṇa ṭṭhiti atta bhāva paṭilābho ti
translated: Are feeling, becoming, destiny, station of consciousness, reappearance, acquisition of individuality,
not so, etc.
Is there any action that has feeling as its destination?
not so, etc.
Are there any beings who have feeling as their destination?
not so, etc.

original: vedanāya sattā jāyanti jīyanti mīyanti cavanti upapajjantīti?
analyzed: vedanāya sattāḥ jāyanti jīyanti mīyanti cavanti upapajjanti iti
translated: Are beings born, age, die, pass away, reappear, because of feeling?
not so, etc.

original: vedanāya atthi vedanā saññā saṅkhārā viññāṇanti?
analyzed: vedanāya atthi vedanā saññā saṅkhārā viññāṇanti
translated: Is there in feeling feeling, perception, volition, consciousness?
not so, etc.

analyzed: vedanā  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: Is feeling the fourfold becoming?🔽not so, etc.

analyzed: a rūpa dhātu bhavaḥ gati pe
translated: Is the formless element becoming, destiny, …
acquisition of individuality?
Agreed.
Is feeling becoming, destiny, …

analyzed: atta bhāva paṭilābho ti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: acquisition of individuality?🔽not so, etc.
Is there any action that has the formless element as its destination?
Agreed.
Is there any action that has feeling as its destination?
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: atthi arūpa dhātu upagā sattā ati
translated: “Then is it not so that there are beings who reappear in the formless world?”
“Yes.”
“Is it not so that there are beings who reappear in the sphere of infinite consciousness?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Arūpadhātuyā sattā jāyanti jīyanti mīyanti cavanti upapajjantīti?
analyzed: arūpa dhātuyā sattāḥ jāyanti jīyanti mīyanti cavanti upapajjanti iti
translated: “Do beings take rebirth in the formless world?”
“Yes.”

original: Vedanāya sattā jāyanti jīyanti mīyanti cavanti upapajjantīti?
analyzed: vedanāya sattāḥ jāyanti jīyanti mīyanti cavanti upapajjanti iti
translated: “Do beings take rebirth in the sphere of infinite consciousness?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the past, the future, and the present?” …

original: arūpadhātuyā atthi vedanā saññā saṅkhārā viññāṇanti?
analyzed: arūpa dhātuyāḥ atthi vedanā saññā saṅkhārāḥ viññāṇanti
translated: “In the formless world there are feelings, perceptions, thought, and consciousness?”
“Yes.”

original: Vedanāya atthi vedanā saññā saṅkhārā viññāṇanti?
analyzed: vedanāya atthi vedanā saññā saṅkhārā viññāṇanti
translated: “In the sphere of infinite consciousness there are feelings, perceptions, thought, and consciousness?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the past, the future, and the present?” …
“The formless world is a fourfold existence?”
“Yes.”
“The sphere of infinite consciousness is a fourfold existence?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Arūpino dhammā arūpadhātu, kāmadhātuyā atthi vedanā saññā saṅkhārā viññāṇanti?
analyzed: arūpino dhammā arūpa dhātu kāmadhātuyāḥ atthi vedanā saññā saṅkhārāḥ viññāṇanti
translated: “Formless states are the formless world. In the sense world there are feelings, perceptions, thought, and consciousness?”
“Yes.”
“Is the sense world the formless world?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the formless world the sense world?”
“Yes.”

original: Kāmabhavena samannāgato puggalo dvīhi bhavehi samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: kāma bhavena samannāgataḥ puggalaḥ dvīhi bhavehi samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: Is a person who possesses the sensual-sphere existence also possessed of two kinds of existence?

analyzed: kāma bhavena ca arūpa bhavena ca ati
translated: Is he also possessed of the fine-material and the immaterial kinds of existence?
“That cannot be said.”

original: Rūpino dhammā rūpadhātu, arūpino dhammā arūpadhātu, kāmadhātuyā atthi rūpaṁ vedanā saññā saṅkhārā viññāṇanti?🔽Āmantā.
analyzed: rūpino dhammā rūpa dhātu arūpino dhammā arūpa dhātu kāmadhātuyāḥ atthi rūpam vedanā saññā saṅkhārāḥ viññāṇanti  āmantā
translated: Are the material dhammas the fine-material element, and the immaterial dhammas the immaterial element?

original: Sāva kāmadhātu, sā rūpadhātu, sā arūpadhātūti?
analyzed: sā ava kāmadhātu sā rūpadhātu sā a rūpadhātu uti
translated: Is the sensual-sphere element also the fine-material element and the immaterial element?
“That cannot be said.”

original: sāva kāmadhātu, sā rūpadhātu, sā arūpadhātūti?
analyzed: sā ava kāmadhātu sā rūpadhātu sā a rūpadhātu uti
translated: Is the sensual-sphere element also the fine-material element and the immaterial element?

original: Āmantā.🔽Kāmabhavena samannāgato puggalo tīhi bhavehi samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: āmantā  kāma bhavena samannāgataḥ puggalo tīhi bhavehi samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: “Yes.”🔽Is a person who possesses the sensual-sphere existence also possessed of three kinds of existence?

original: kāmabhavena ca rūpabhavena ca arūpabhavena cāti?
analyzed: kāma bhavena ca rūpa bhavena ca arūpa bhavena ca ati
translated: Is he also possessed of the fine-material and the immaterial kinds of existence?
“That cannot be said.”
The Discussion of the Immaterial-Sphere Element is finished.
